chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order (2nd+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott C Batra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order (2nd+) [Modifiers: Extend Order for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections supervision fees. If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
DOC COLLECT 
------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No bars, taverns, or liquor stores. No driving without a valid driver's license. 
------------------

Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan 
------------------
Lifetime revocation of Driver's License. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment

Defendant in court in custody with attorney Obi Uzowulu. ADA Crawford appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for sentencing hearing. PSI filed, defense has reviewed with clients; minor material corrections made on page 3,8, 9 and page 10, 12, 17, 19 and 24. Defendant makes statement in regards to material corrections. State has correction on prior conviction section and notes a duplication.

911 am Argument by ADA Crawford recommends 12 years WSP, IC 7 years, ES 5 years
923 am Argument by Atty Uzowulu request minimum prison sentence


934 am Defendant makes statement to court

937  Court goes over sentencing factors/objectives
Court gives warnings as to voter ineligibility and unlawful firearm possession

SENTENCE

22CF4 
CT#1
Wisconsin State Prison - WSP  11 1/2 years; bifurcated
Initial Confinement (IC) 6 1 /2 years
Extended Supervision (ES) 5 years

Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP) = No
Substance Abuse Program (SAP) = Yes

Conditions of Extended Supervision
Lifetime Revocation
36 months IID Requirement
$500 FINE plus costs
No alcohol
No drugs or drug paraphernalia
No bars taverns or liquor stores
No driving without a valid drivers license
Comply with IID requirements
Standard A & R
Counseling as recommended by Agent
DNA sample/surcharge


CT#2
$250 Fine plus costs

CT#3
$150 Fine plus costs

22TR60 dismissed

Court in recess at 953 am

Court in session at 1002 am. Defendant in court in custody with attorney Obi Uzowulu. ADA Crawford appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for sentencing hearing. Defense requesting a reset to review PSI with client. No objection by State. Court addresses defendant as to sentencing and matter being set over for PSI to be reviewed. Matter set over to next week 9-12 at 9am. Writ to be extended. Court in recess at 1008 am.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Original filed with court.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott C Batra in court, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Scott C Batra. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1, 2 & 3. Victim(s) have been given notice of hearing. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. PSI Ordered. Parties stipulate this is 8th offense. Acknowledge 7 priors. Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court gives warning to deportation, firearm possession and voting ineligibility.  Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

8:35 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott C Batra not in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Scott C Batra. 
Atty Uzowulo requests a Plea and sentence date. 
Court will set for a plea and a Writ to be prepared. 
Plea hearing set for June 24, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560
No victims.

8:32 AM Case called. Defendant Scott C Batra appeared by video from Kettle Moraine Corr..  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Scott C Batra. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Uzowulu asks for a couple weeks to review for possible plea. 
State agrees to reset. 
Plea hearing set for June 3, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560

records.addlTxt: Tony Kim

Defendant Scott C Batra in court, in custody by video with attorney Tony Kim.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading of complaint waived.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by Attorney. Rights given and hearing requested, within time periods. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without an IID installed.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
